qas.question: What branch did Northwestern open in Education City, Doha, Qatar?
What bachelor's degree is offered at NU-Q through the Medill School of Journalism?
Who provided the funding for the construction and administrative costs for NU-Q?

answers.text: The Qatar Foundation for Education, Science and Community Development

qas.question: How long is the NU-Q branch of Northwestern scheduled to operate through an agreement in 2016?
What bachelor's degree is offered at NU-Q through the School of Communication?
What branch did Southwestern open in Education City, Doha, Qatar?
What non-bachelor's degree is offered at NU-Q through the Medill School of Journalism?

plausible_answers.text: The Qatar Foundation for Education, Science and Community Development

qas.question: Who provided the funding for the construction and administrative costs for NI-Q?
How long is the NU-Q branch of Northwestern scheduled to operate through an agreement in 2006?
What bachelor's degree is offered at NI-Q through the School of Communication?

context: In Fall 2008, Northwestern opened a campus in Education City, Doha, Qatar, joining five other American universities: Carnegie Mellon University, Cornell University, Georgetown University, Texas A&M University, and Virginia Commonwealth University. Through the Medill School of <b6_0>Journalism<b6_0/> and School of Communication, <a0_0><b5_0>NU-Q<b5_0/><a0_0/> offers bachelor's degrees in <a1_0><a4_0><b9_0>journalism<b9_0/><a4_0/><a1_0/> and communication respectively. <a2_0><b7_0>The Qatar Foundation for Education, Science and Community Development<b7_0/><a2_0/> provided funding for construction and administrative costs as well as support to hire 50 to 60 faculty and staff, some of whom rotate between the Evanston and Qatar campuses. In February 2016, Northwestern reached an agreement with the Qatar Foundation to extend the operations of the NU-Q branch for an additional decade, <a3_0>through the <b8_0>2027-2028 academic year<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
